STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 7, 2022
Michael Milks
Genesee County DHHS
125 E. Union
Flint, MI 48502
RE: License #: CP250201139
Genesee County DHHS
125 E. Union
Flint, MI 48502
Dear Mr. Milks:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
04/06/2022. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 An explanation why previous corrective action plans have not
obtained and maintained compliance for rules found in repeat non-
compliance.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3012
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
In one out of eight foster children records reviewed, one was
o n e d a y l a t e f o r the initial services plan dated 7/9/21 – 8/7/21.
The report was submitted on 8/8/21.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each
child and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and
at least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
In one out of three independent living case records reviewed,
one was late for the updated services plan dated 4/1/21 –
6/29/21. The report was submitted on 6/30/21.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM 2021 INTERIM
R 400.12510 Independent living contract.
(2) The agreement shall be signed and dated by the youth
and the social service worker. The contract shall be
reviewed and updated at least once every 90 calendar days
and a copy provided to the youth.
In three out of three independent living case records reviewed,
three were not dated or consistent with quarterly reviews every
90 days.
R 400.12511 Termination.
(1) When an agency terminates its independent living
services for a youth, the agency shall document all of the
4

following information in the case record within 30 calendar
days of termination of its services:
In one out of two independent living termination case records reviewed,
The case was closed on 04/29/21 but was not signed until 04/04/22
surpassing the 30 calendar days for signatures of termination of services.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS
MiSACWIS
(Commitment
22)
DHHS will maintain an operational statewide automated
child welfare information system (MiSACWIS) which will be
the primary tracking system and satisfy federal reporting
requirements.
The following information required for this audit was not uploaded into MiSACWIS
timely or was missing:
Written closing summary from the foster parent
Special Investigation 259 closure
Parent Agency Treatment Agreement
Updated Medical Passports
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that there
are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in section
1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements
except for the following:
DHHS POLICY Required Participation in Service Plans
FOM 722 -8D
Required signatures: Parent(s), guardian(s), Foster care
worker, Supervisor, Foster parent, caregiver, any youth
age 14+
In three out of eight children case records reviewed, three case records
PATP’s were signed pass the 30 calendar days required.
One report was not signed by the foster parent.
5

One report was not signed by the foster child.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
DHHS Policy FOM 722-08C Page 2 Required Participation in Development -
Foster Parent / Caregiver
All foster parents that are on a license are required to sign the PATP in the
development of the foster child’s service plans. The boxes are to be checked
indicating that they assisted in the development of the service plans.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan dated 04/23/2021 for the Interim
Inspection findings.
VII. DCWL FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The Analyst’s inspection found one safety alert:
Concern:
1. There is an additional teenage girl with her 8 month old child residing in the home for
an undetermined amount of time.
2. There is not crib in the home for the infant to sleep in.
Solution:
Genesee MDHHS had not been informed of the teen moving into the household with a
child. The teen was living in an area in the city that was adjacent to a recent home
explosion that resulted in her currently living with the foster parents. The staff
discussed the living arrangements with the provider on 12/17/21 and rectified the safe
sleep safety concern with the provision of the pack and play being placed in the home.
The photo of the pack and play is attached to this solution.
Additional information includes the following:
The teen and her child’s stay at the foster parent’s home was intended to be temporary.
The teen and her child left the home on December 26, 2021, Although the teen and her
6

child no longer resides at the residence, checks/clearances completed on her did not
reveal any concerning information.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that Genesee County DHHS
will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
04/08/2022
________________________________________
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
April 8, 2022
________________________________________
Linda Tansil Date
Area Manager
